judges: Before Jones, C. J., Eagen, O’Brien, Roberts, Pomeroy, Nix and Mán-DERINO, JJ.

opinions.text:
Opinion
Per Curiam,
Appeal dismissed, having been taken from an unappealable Order, see: Commonwealth v. Haines, 410 Pa. 601, 190 A. 2d 118 (1963), i.e., an Order directing acquittal of the defendant.
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

attorneys: Martin H. Belshy, Assistant District Attorney, with him Milton M. Stein, Assistant District Attorney, James D. Crawford, Deputy District Attorney, Richard A. Sprague, First Assistant District Attorney, and Ar-Katz, and Donshy, Katz, .Levin and Bashman, for appellee.
Francis X. Nolan, with him. Stanley Bashman, Leon Katz, and Donshy, Katz, Levin and Bashman, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
Commonwealth, Appellant, v. Rios.
Argued January 10, 1972.
Before Jones, C. J., Eagen, O’Brien, Roberts, Pomeroy, Nix and Mán-DERINO, JJ.
Martin H. Belshy, Assistant District Attorney, with him Milton M. Stein, Assistant District Attorney, James D. Crawford, Deputy District Attorney, Richard A. Sprague, First Assistant District Attorney, and Ar-Katz, and Donshy, Katz, .Levin and Bashman, for appellee.
Francis X. Nolan, with him. Stanley Bashman, Leon Katz, and Donshy, Katz, Levin and Bashman, for appellee.
April 20, 1972:
